data.text:
Sport teaches girls how to:
👏 Stand in solidarity
💪 Be resilient & confident
🤼‍♀️ Trust teamwork

#WomenInSport defy gender stereotypes & social norms, make inspiring role models & demonstrate equality. https://t.co/WjijKfI1Il via @UN_Women #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/ngoOMktToJ

The root system of mangroves can help defend us against extreme weather.

By protecting mangroves, we protect ourselves.

More on the magic of mangroves from @FAO on Monday's #MangroveDay: 
https://t.co/dCXKfP0JMg

The @Tokyo2020 Olympics will have close to equal representation of women & men athletes for the first time in the history of the games.

Sport is one of the great drivers of gender equality. via @UN_Women https://t.co/S45xTRmZQD

By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the ocean. The time to #BeatPlasticPollution is NOW.

The incredible images from around the world featured in this inspiring exhibit show how #PlasticIsForever: https://t.co/nPGl2lNJqs https://t.co/8gQd6iO78N

By taking #ClimateAction, each of us can help achieve a green economy & more sustainable future.

@UNDP explores how in latest 'Hello Future' episode: https://t.co/WH5xvxkW3H https://t.co/HK8BuPUSND

A disproportionate number of women lost their jobs during the pandemic, and fewer women are expected to return to work, says @ILO. 

Only 43% of working-age women expected to be employed in 2021, compared to 69% of their male counterparts. https://t.co/D2vMI54La4

"As we are not distracted by vision, I think the shaking of our house during the shelling was even stronger for us." 

Meet Rania & Abdallah, a visually impaired couple in Syria, whose optimism & strength defy even the darkest moments. via @WFP_MENA https://t.co/0NJgPUHTfK

Drowning is among the ten leading causes of death for children & youth.

@WHO has more on Sunday's first-ever World #DrowningPrevention Day: https://t.co/TfxsqCPWwY https://t.co/AMXRjvmF1T

During these times of high-stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others.

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and #OnlyTogether will we end the pandemic. 

🎨: @Madwellington https://t.co/g6BSZuoxjC

Over 230k people die from drowning every year. Drowning can be prevented by:
🔹 installing barriers controlling access to water
🔹 providing safe places away from water 
🔹 teaching swimming & water safety

Sunday is 1st-ever World #DrowningPrevention Day: https://t.co/zkkpW1QCWd https://t.co/mx7MuIUS90

"We are human, we have the same principles, and you discover amazing people when you're working with them."

-- First Lieutenant Jorge López, from Spain, shares his experience as UN peacekeeper #ServingForPeace with @UNIFIL_. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/GKn08txc5H

"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels & many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

-- @sunitanar explains the importance of the #ParisAgreement. https://t.co/MWhGAcRudh https://t.co/hAUBa5GRd9

Peace is a prerequisite for health, equality & human security -- and women's voices are needed to create lasting peace.

From conflict prevention to economic recovery, women have a valuable role to play in creating a more peaceful world. via @UN_Women https://t.co/vKcw5vZNcK

A new global dashboard aims to help expand access to #COVID19 vaccines. 

@UNDP, @WHO & partners hope this tool will illustrate the social & economic benefits of accelerating vaccine equity to save save lives & recover better. https://t.co/wIlStKc9Pz https://t.co/r0BAP5w0R5

UN Peacekeepers protect civilians, prevent the spread of violence and help countries achieve lasting peace.  

More about @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/67UTXS1EIp #A4P https://t.co/wzk6HkYwjb

The global death rate from #COVID19 is accelerating. 

We must continue to stay vigilant. Get vaccinated if you can, follow health guidance where you live and keep up precautions like physical distancing & wearing a mask to help stop the spread. https://t.co/S4JgZXwuOv

The #RefugeeOlympicTeam is ready to compete at the #Tokyo2020 @Olympics.

These 29 athletes are proof of the power of sport to bring hope, heal and help refugees rebuild their future.

Support the team and #CheerForRefugees! https://t.co/g6i3rIjteL via @Refugees

.@UNStamps is celebrating #Tokyo2020 with a new set of commemorative stamps highlighting how sport can help build a more peaceful world. 

Get yours at https://t.co/0RwXCPvj5k https://t.co/c0RxccmcRK

Friday marks 100 days until the UN Climate Conference #COP26.

To limit global temperature rise to 1.5°C, countries need to step up their #ClimateAction now.

More from @UNFCCC: https://t.co/xiPJYuhKRP https://t.co/43lpD7aD8g

"The Olympic spirit brings out humanity’s best: 

Teamwork and solidarity. 
Talent. 
Tolerance. 

It inspires and unifies us in troubled times."

-- @antonioguterres' message for @Olympics opening ceremony. https://t.co/PO6DG8HJ2G #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/R6mtZIQUz2

This year, more than half the people in the Central African Republic need humanitarian assistance & protection. 

@UNOCHA says more funding is required to help those most in need, some of whom may die without urgent assistance. https://t.co/Vhs1k2IwTJ

With 100 days left until #COP26, the time for ambitious national #ClimateAction plans is NOW. 

Find out how your country is planning on cutting greenhouse gas emissions to keep global temperature rise under 1.5 °C and safeguard a livable climate: https://t.co/fhnoPpZ7TC https://t.co/S1TEUFInyX

Droughts
Floods
Landslides
Tsunamis

Water is one of the main ways we feel the impacts of the climate crisis, and water-related hazards have dominated disasters in the past 50 years, says new @WMO data. https://t.co/2s2gBoJtxB https://t.co/QBamN89QJE

They've seen the worst in the world. Now they're ready to compete with the best.

Members of the #Tokyo2020 Refugee Olympic Team have arrived in Japan for the @Olympics. We wish them good luck!

 https://t.co/aSiyaTTdPL

From Bangladesh to Syria to Zambia, the UN works around the world to support the fight against #COVID19.

See some examples in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/GxC2AueXWd

Thursday is #WorldBrainDay. 

Tips for good brain health 🧠:
🏃‍♂️ Keep physically active
🍌 Eat a healthy diet
😴 Get enough sleep
🧩 Stimulate your mind
💟 Look after your heart
⛑️ Wear a helmet

More from @WHO: https://t.co/FxedOZ7Dn8 https://t.co/hNayuJk4K9

Increased access to clean energy will help reduce poverty, improve gender equality, enable access to quality education & healthcare and more.

The High-Level Dialogue on Energy aims to step up action on clean energy for all. https://t.co/TUQ8ukMRgK https://t.co/7gCtOIrvDL

The climate crises is creating losses & damages to food systems, more incidents of pests & diseases and increasing heat stress, which negatively affects food production. 

#ClimateAction = action for food security. 

See how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/5oOK4zeN1g

On Thursday, #UNGA will conduct a mid-term review of the International Decade for people of African descent. 

Learn more about the Decade and other efforts to #FightRacism: https://t.co/BSRZ5TNbCo https://t.co/ySYWs4Vmc5

Buying seasonal and local fruits and vegetables is good for your health, the local economy and the environment. 

More #ClimateAction tips from #PeterRabbitFoodHero: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/fjTm6qrMRP

Nelson Mandela's calls for solidarity & to #FightRacism are particularly relevant today, as social cohesion around the world is threatened by division, @AminaJMohammed says at #UNGA meeting commemorating #MandelaDay. https://t.co/LcpFCk4FCV https://t.co/pFCRrTMbOX

Sport can foster diversity, tolerance & respect.
Athletes, influencers & innovators will explore how sport contributes to advancing the #GlobalGoals at the #Tokyo2020 SDG Zone. https://t.co/rq7o9MOlC0

https://t.co/dPsECzXGhH

1.5 million children lost a primary caregiver during the first 14 months of the #COVID19 pandemic, placing them more at risk of mental health problems, poverty & violence. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/cu0z6wkFEm

Every second, the equivalent of one garbage truck full of textiles is thrown away. 

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero - mend, donate and keep clothing out of landfills! https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/Hv49Yx7e5V

➡️ Humanity
➡️ Neutrality
➡️ Impartiality
➡️ Independence

From natural disasters to armed conflict, @WFP remains committed to these four principles when helping people facing hunger around the world. https://t.co/IYY1h66wiB
 https://t.co/w6LFigO2NJ
New outdoor exhibit at UNHQ features images of rural transformations with special focus on food security, ecological change and #ClimateAction. https://t.co/fsuAihb61u https://t.co/sbuX09onY2

UN peacekeepers from Spain are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ https://t.co/JWOnYWInTG

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The risk of wildfires, frequency of disasters & more hinge on these few degrees.

Limiting temperature rise is still possible if we #ActNow. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo via @UNFCCC https://t.co/1P9ni85fxy

.@UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet calls on countries to acknowledge the legacies of the past & work to achieve racial equality & justice for Africans & people of African descent. https://t.co/w4wknIL4fy #FightRacism

📸: Ark of Return, UNHQ https://t.co/msy6adKFAP

82.4 million people worldwide were forcibly displaced at the end of 2020.
Every single one of them is a human being with a unique story of suffering & loss.

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming explains the importance of breathing life into numbers.
https://t.co/dG3XRaPgr1

“Winning the fight against climate change requires urgent & bold action across every industry & we need governments to lead the way.”

-- Climate Ambition Envoy @MikeBloomberg issues report finding that G20 countries need to accelerate #ClimateAction. https://t.co/Qw3d5d88Fj https://t.co/MoaRbNpGyf

23 million children missed out on basic childhood vaccines in 2020 -- the highest number in more than a decade.

Amid the backslide, @UNICEF & @WHO are stressing the need for urgent investment in childhood vaccination efforts. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/VKIcXaF0gm

Tuesday's #WorldChessDay is an opportunity to celebrate the ways in which chess can foster dialogue, solidarity and a culture of peace.⁣ 

Find out more: https://t.co/dkqPUaWyzA https://t.co/wCxFh17ZTx

Myanmar: Independent @UNHumanRights experts express concern about the situation of human rights defenders in the country and call for stronger international response to ensure their protection. https://t.co/SaJn4hAFJo

Games & sports can help support people's well-being during times of crisis, including the #COVID19 pandemic, by reducing anxieties & improving mental health. 

More on Tuesday's #WorldChessDay: https://t.co/dkqPUaWyzA https://t.co/Bu6k0B662u

Eid Mubarak!

As people around the world celebrate #EidAlAdha, each of us can draw encouragement from the values of solidarity, empathy and compassion that are inspired by Eid. https://t.co/39vlQDY50H

Inequalities between women & men in the world of work have been exacerbated by #COVID19, with a disproportionate number of women losing their jobs. 

@ILO warns employment & income losses suffered by women during the pandemic are expected to persist. https://t.co/JdgbUjXYQq

Empowering children to be heroic & impactful leaders for change is crucial for a better future. 

Our #ClimateAction Superheroes can help engage & educate kids on how to #ActNow to address the climate crisis: https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC https://t.co/CUlUU0O2Zb

Each of us can help transform our food systems to protect our ecosystems: 
✅ Preserve forests, oceans, lakes & rivers
✅ Raise environmental standards
✅ Empower local communities
 
More ideas to promote @FoodSystems of the future: https://t.co/FPOBRsli4C https://t.co/ujAAzX7ZSw

Spain provides nearly 850 military & police officers to @UNPeacekeeping.

We thank these brave women & men, who leave their families behind to protect others, for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/gxZIfTMSBz

Open science is key in the fight against #COVID19, the climate crisis and much more. 

Join this week's virtual Open Science Conference to learn more: https://t.co/deKNmWZ36s via @UNLibrary & @UNDESA https://t.co/Tyaa5hEcqr

By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the ocean. The time to #BeatPlasticPollution is NOW.

The incredible images from around the world featured in this inspiring exhibit show how #PlasticIsForever: https://t.co/nPGl2lNJqs https://t.co/pFKyJzkUdZ

#VaccinesWork! They help prevent millions of deaths every year and are continuously monitored to ensure they are safe and effective.

More facts from @WHO: https://t.co/UUx1Hw4vsv https://t.co/6PqESsN7VM

From challenging gender stereotypes to sharing care work -- we all have an important role to play in achieving gender equality. 

Here are 7 tips for parents from @UN_Women. ⬇️ https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB https://t.co/9zgN6CceFm
On Sunday's #MandelaDay & every day, Nelson Mandela's words inspire us to "ensure that democracy, peace & prosperity prevail everywhere." https://t.co/g3tnavJabU https://t.co/ctpgnMuDV9

The draft global framework #ForNature includes a plan to:
🟢 protect at least 30% of the world’s land & sea areas
🟢 reduce pesticides by at least two thirds
🟢 eliminate plastic waste

More from @UNBiodiversity: https://t.co/I3k6KOZD6e https://t.co/29ZJFr5AcU

Sunday's #MandelaDay is an opportunity to honour Madiba's commitment to freedom, justice & equality. 

See how he contributed to the work of the UN in this virtual exhibit: https://t.co/fca6bxGJMV https://t.co/OeD2WQSFYg

"Being a peacekeeper makes me proud."

-- UN peacekeepers from Serbia share their experience #ServingForPeace amid #COVID19 & providing medical services to communities affected by the conflict in the Central African Republic. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/rQlwwPxdOB

"We must never forget that it is our duty to protect this environment." 

On Sunday's #MandelaDay & every day, you can build on Mandela's legacy and change the world for the better.

Every #ClimateAction counts. #ActNow for a more sustainable future: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/FXG5h2Yi46

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The survival of animals, the frequency of disasters, the spread of diseases & more hinge on these few degrees.

We need #ClimateAction now. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV via @UNFCCC https://t.co/zcQM8wJ9bF

"Racism must be opposed by all means that humanity has at its disposal," said @NelsonMandela at UNHQ in 1990.

Sunday's #MandelaDay provides us an opportunity to learn from Madiba's legacy -- to take action and inspire change. https://t.co/g3tnavrzkm #FightRacism https://t.co/q7O7Ccv3i6

"Our intention in the future is that the women survivors will live in dignity & without violence."

Meet Mirlina Sada, who with support from @UNMIKosovo, is transforming the lives of survivors of conflict related sexual violence. https://t.co/nXnCPWKWON https://t.co/Fe1K2d2tAC

Sub-Saharan Africa is home to 67% of people living with HIV -- an illness that puts them at higher risk of severe #COVID19. 

Yet, less than 3% of people in that region have been able to receive a vaccine against coronavirus. 

More from @UNAIDS: https://t.co/stOl5dgnEX https://t.co/Vi5OiasoS2

In times of crisis such as #COVID19, we must protect the vulnerable & unite to achieve peace & justice.

On Saturday's Day of International Criminal Justice, see how the @IntlCrimCourt works towards building a #MoreJustWorld. https://t.co/1mpyOwvsQ7 https://t.co/EnwQjGHetq

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, world hunger is on the rise.

➡️ Up to 811 million people worldwide face hunger.
➡️ 149 million children under 5 years are stunted.
➡️ 3 billion people are struggling to maintain healthy diets.

https://t.co/d76JUTI1xp via @WFP #SOFI2021 https://t.co/w4L0uemuMp

The Delta variant is spreading faster than any other #COVID19 variant. But there are steps we can all take to help stop it:

😷 Wear a mask
🙂↔️🙂 Maintain physical distance
🧴 Wash hands frequently
🪟 Open windows & doors https://t.co/TgjHALpLRv

People affected by conflict are taking action for peace & justice, in hope of creating a #MoreJustWorld.

On Saturday's Day of International Criminal Justice get inspired by their stories.  https://t.co/djg22WC8ht via @IntlCrimCourt https://t.co/Lzc7VSM1LG

🇺🇳 ”We the peoples...” 🇺🇳

The UN works for everyone, everywhere -- by helping tackle the #COVID19 crisis, promoting peace & security, striving to achieve the #GlobalGoals, and urging all people to #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/917HhoriT9 #WorldEmojiDay https://t.co/5mlKNEdss1

Take action. Inspire change.

Ahead of Sunday's #MandelaDay, take the @GetKahoot quiz & learn more about the life & legacy of @NelsonMandela: https://t.co/1P3OLmEHcg https://t.co/ggEdcETV00

🌡 Heat
🔥 Fire
🌊 Floods
The northern hemisphere is seeing a summer of extremes. 

@WMO explains how the climate crisis is already increasing the frequency of extreme weather events: https://t.co/qjKicWtPC7 #ClimateAction https://t.co/3TCHfV2AA7

“I am very concerned at the alleged use of excessive force against demonstrators in Cuba and the arrest of a large number of people.”

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet calls for prompt release of all those detained for exercising their rights. https://t.co/nWuU0lgJym

Serbia provides more than 260 military & police officers to @UNPeacekeeping.

We thank these brave women & men, who leave their families behind to protect others, for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/j0SAE3F4ul

We've all missed doing the things we love during the pandemic. But #OnlyTogether can we overcome the #COVID19 crisis.

Check out our latest @TwitterMoments for examples of solidarity and compassion, which show the very best of humanity. https://t.co/ioYhWJyAcl

#COVID19 cases in Africa and elsewhere are rising fast. 

We need to share vaccines fairly around the world. Consider donating to make sure everyone, everywhere, is protected. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/Y4FyLTBN1A https://t.co/8O719Wc1US

Libya: "Positive steps are now needed to avoid backsliding."

-- @UNJanKubis, head of @UNSMILibya asks for sustained support from the Security Council. https://t.co/ISMzbpBJBB

With political leadership, solidarity and unity of purpose, we can end the #COVID19 pandemic, improve people’s lives and keep the promise of the #GlobalGoals, @AminaJMohammed stresses at closing of #HLPF. https://t.co/feYmmHj85k

"I call on all parties to conflict to observe the Olympic Truce during the Tokyo Olympic and Paralympic Games, and to build on it in the weeks and months ahead."

-- @antonioguterres ahead of #Tokyo2020. https://t.co/kcM16cFLPI https://t.co/wGNaEhra54

Conspiracy theories, rumors and lies continue to spread at a troubling speed amid #COVID19.

We can all do something to help address this serious misinformation challenge - by sharing only accurate, scientific, factual information. https://t.co/xZZ1FJXp9y https://t.co/o9C5n5Nd7m

23 million children missed out on vaccines in 2020 – 3.7 million more than in 2019.

@UNICEF & @WHO are stressing the urgent need to invest in childhood vaccination efforts to ensure every child is able to receive life-saving vaccines. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/gQLEFAbAHw

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The length of droughts, the spread of diseases & more hinge on these few degrees.

Limiting temperature rise is still possible if we #ActNow. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n via @UNFCCC https://t.co/ryr6q42w7L

Thursday is World Youth Skills Day!

Equipping young people with skills for employment, decent work & entrepreneurship is more important than ever.

Key facts here: https://t.co/ehDvixAfzD https://t.co/s04QW28Ojp

During these times of high stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others. 

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and #OnlyTogether will get through this. 

🎨: @aysegulaltinel https://t.co/JMNDSdNKWu

Distance learning has become a fundamental way of teaching amid the pandemic.

On Thursday’s World Youth Skills Day, @ILO is calling for high quality education & training to equip youth with the competencies they need for the future. https://t.co/1yZTr91moW https://t.co/Cifj44Id96

At least 1,146 people died attempting to reach Europe by sea so far this year, although the actual toll is estimated to be higher.

Migrant deaths along these routes more than doubled compared to the same period in 2020, warns @UNMigration. 
https://t.co/AMMpDlyqhb

On Thursday's World Youth Skills Day, join @UNESCO in celebrating the importance of youth skills development & recognizing the key role of young people in building a more sustainable future. https://t.co/H2ybfPaTkr https://t.co/b6IIhnOGIj

#COVID19 cases are surging in some low-income countries where vaccines aren't widely available, increasing death rates & spread of new variant. 

Consider donating to make sure vaccines can reach everyone, everywhere. #OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/zSzJbzN9Sl https://t.co/TFXInTbH44

“The highest attainable standard of health is one of the fundamental rights of every human being and that right is being denied to most within Myanmar. The international community must act.”

-- Independent @UNHumanRights expert.
https://t.co/NryYipUHIb

#COVID19 lockdowns & other restrictions have severely disrupted HIV testing in many countries, resulting in drops in diagnoses, referrals to care services & treatment. 

More in latest @UNAIDS global report: https://t.co/IOn8d4cTr4 https://t.co/Uc17ntL9dS

From cooking fuel alternatives to solar power innovations, many Africans are rising to the challenge of solving age-old issues in a sustainable way.

@DamilolaSDG7 from @SEforALLorg talks about energy issues on the continent: https://t.co/of4AQdbQJd #SDGLive https://t.co/PiADLQ0prs

The 17 #GlobalGoals will be celebrated with music & action on 17 July!  🎵

Artists & activists are coming together to #TurnItAround for #ClimateAction, equality & sustainable food systems for all!

Serbia provides military & police officers to five @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world.

We thank these brave women & men for #ServingForPeace, including amid the challenging conditions caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/6ciwvvtEwR

Let us renew our determination to build a strong, sustainable and inclusive recovery from the pandemic, and to take decisive action together to defeat the climate crisis and keep the promise of the #GlobalGoals.

-- @antonioguterres at #HLPF. https://t.co/ckeBWZqcU8

"The peace process in Colombia, almost five years after the signing of the Peace Agreement, is entering a crucial stage."

-- @MisionONUCol head @CGRuizMassieu to Security Council. https://t.co/5gjnUk7Pz0

Humanitarians are working to provide emergency shelter & food to those newly displaced, but challenges remain in reaching the most vulnerable. https://t.co/IgHnT3A36c

https://t.co/5patufQjoz
